KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.X003!D.dialogue_text: As Eidos approaches, the guardian ceremoniously turns its face towards her in a stiff, stuttering motion. Lifting its massive spear from the ground, it lets the shaft fall into a firm two-handed grip while adopting a stance to more fully block the passage.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.X0030!.dialogue_text: Soon it drops a jittery jaw and begins to chew on words in an attempt to communicate.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.X004!D.dialogue_text: As Eidos approaches, she feels a Glyph bubble up to the forefront of her consciousness. With each step she takes, the form becomes clearer, yet remains uninvoked. The sentry has not yet reacted, and Eidos remains undetected. It stands motionless with its spear at its side, as if to deny Eidos' very existence.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.X0040!.dialogue_text: Eidos calls out to the sentry and the guardian ceremoniously turns its face towards her in a stiff, stuttering motion. Lifting its massive spear from the ground, it lets the shaft fall into a firm two-handed grip while adopting a stance to more fully block the passage.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.0041!D.dialogue_text:
Instinct becomes will, will then becoming thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.

		The Glyph of the Occult lends power to its Hidden Mind Techne casting an invisible veil around Eidos. The brief flash of the Glyph dissipates in her mind's eye and she begins walking as silently as possible towards the doorway - almost skulking like a frightened dog. Nerves balanced on the edge of a knife, she proceeds, until...

A.response_text: Her mind calls out to the dormant sentry

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.00410!.dialogue_text: Quickening her pace, she rushes past the sentry without incident, soon entering the chamber beyond.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.X00411.dialogue_text: Much ado about nothing, perhaps... For Hidden Mind seems to work to great effect on this guardian.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.000!DE.dialogue_text: As soon as she steps upon the platform, a violet light seems to carve a Glyph into its center. A slight rumble and it drops into a shadowy shaft, carrying Eidos into the depths little slower than a free fall.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.001!DE.dialogue_text: The floating platform speeds up through the shaft, bathing Eidos in stale air as she rushes towards this little journey's terminus. Slowing to a halt, she emerges up from the ground and into a shadowy alcove within a narrow hall.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!2.X000!D.dialogue_text:
This short and narrow hallway is lined with the graven images of men and women at arms. They are finely carved, with no trace nor marks of the tools that wrought them. Yet, their forms are rough and simplistic, comprised of angles and lines but few curves.

		The ceiling is comparably low, such that Eidos could reach up and touch it; the width, scarcely wider than her armspan. At the end of the corridor is a single door and a staircase leading down into the darkness of the depths.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!2.X001!D.dialogue_text: A tall statuesque figure stands guard here, immediately turning to confront Eidos.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!2.002!DE.dialogue_text: A tall statuesque figure stands guard here, though it does not react to Eidos' presence.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!5.000!DE.dialogue_text: The familiar narrow hallway and its resident sentry greet Eidos as her first footfalls echo through the hall. In an alcove, nearly consumed in shadows, a Glyph etched upon a floating platform appears to call to her, offering an escape.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!6.000!DE.dialogue_text: Having decided not to quarrel with the sentry, Eidos seeks the safety and certainty of the chamber whence she came...

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!9.000!DE.dialogue_text: The corpse of the slain sentry lies in a pool of viscous, blue fluid, appearing as lifeless as the reliefs lining this narrow hall. Eidos' path, now unobstructed, points in one of three directions.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.X000!S.dialogue_text: "Nole lanipahoi. En voi tatan atohi latal latava. Nole vahy katanya isinkata."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.X001!S.dialogue_text: "As intruder I see you. None must pass."

D.response_text: "Perhaps you can make an exception in my case..."

E.response_text: "I don't answer to you."

F.response_text: "But it's dark and scary down there!"

A.response_text: "You speak as though you have no choice."

E.response_text: "None of this matters. I will pass."

A.response_text: "You speak as though you have no choice."

E.response_text: "None of this matters. I will pass."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.X200!S.dialogue_text: "My post is here and here alone. My ken and I are to here restricted."

A.response_text: "You speak as though you have no choice."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.200!SE.dialogue_text: "My post is here and here alone. My ken and I are to here restricted."

A.response_text: "You speak as though you have no choice."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.400!SE.dialogue_text: "Clear is my task. None shall pass, until my master commands."

D.response_text: "Oh, but there must be other areas that deserve your attention..."

E.response_text: "None of this matters. I will pass."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.500!SE.dialogue_text: "Clear is my task. None shall pass, until my master commands."

A.response_text: "You speak as though you have no choice."

D.response_text: "Surely, there are other areas that deserve your attention."

E.response_text: "None of this matters. I will pass."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.600!SE.dialogue_text: "Perhaps truth is with you, but woe unto those that through here pass."

D.response_text: "Oh, but there must be other areas that deserve your attention..."

E.response_text: "None of this matters. I will pass."

F.response_text: "I'll only go back down there if you come with me."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.101!SE.dialogue_text: "Indeed, the choice is not mine; I do as commanded. Protection was my command; death, the punishment to those who pass."

A.response_text: "I mean no harm! There's no need for violence."

E.response_text: "Then, I command you to die, slave."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.201!SE.dialogue_text: "The watcher am I. Upon me rests the safety of the Sanctuary, and that which it holds."

A.response_text: "I cannot stop here and I'm prepared to defend myself."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.2011!S.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's will, this hall stands under my watchful eye."

A.response_text: "I cannot stop here and I'm prepared to defend myself."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.X401!S.dialogue_text: "Safe are the lower areas. In faith my people carry out the will of our master. Protection was my command; death, the punishment to those who pass."

C.response_text: "Then I will not attempt to enter."

E.response_text: "Funny, death is the punishment for those who seek to thwart me..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.4011!S.dialogue_text: "Safe are the lower areas. In faith my people carry out the will of our master. Protection was my command; death, the punishment to those who pass."

E.response_text: "Funny, death is the punishment for those who seek to thwart me..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.501!SE.dialogue_text: "Protection was my command; death, the punishment to those who pass."

A.response_text: "I don't want to harm you. So stand aside."

E.response_text: "You must be tired of living."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.X601!S.dialogue_text: "My post is here and here alone. My ken and I are to here restricted."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.601!SE.dialogue_text: "My post is here and here alone. My ken and I are to here restricted."

F.response_text: "What if I stole your pants and threw them outside?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.102!SE.dialogue_text: "No harm can befall this sentry; beyond harm am I in my perfection. Leave."

E.response_text: Attack the sentry

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.202!SE.dialogue_text: "Death lies beyond; attempt to pass and you will know it. Leave."

E.response_text: Attack the sentry

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.402!SE.dialogue_text: "Shielded by truth am I to whatever light blinds you from it; leave or die."

E.response_text: Attack the sentry

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.4022!S.dialogue_text: "If the Archive is watched not by my kin, then not dead do they lie; we are, else, we are not. Leave."

E.response_text: Attack the sentry

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.502!SE.dialogue_text: "Words which are empty act not as commands; my master's will abides. Leave."

E.response_text: Attack the sentry

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.602!SE.dialogue_text: "As it should be, all is. Thus, my face."

E.response_text: Attack the gremlin menace

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!0.6022!S.dialogue_text: "What happens, happens. As it should be, all is."

E.response_text: Attack the gremlin menace

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.X000!S.dialogue_text: "Nole lanipahoi. En voi tatan atohi latal latava. Nole vahy katanya isinkata."

A.response_text: "Stand aside and let me through; there is no need for violence."

C.response_text: "I don't understand, but I don't want to die again. I'll leave."

E.response_text: "I'll keep coming back to kill you, as long as it takes."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.000!SE.dialogue_text: "As intruder I see you. None must pass."

B.response_text: "You killed me. How is it that I still live?"

C.response_text: "I wish no further violence. I'll leave."

D.response_text: "It seems I'm incapable of defeat. Stand aside!"

E.response_text: "I've come for my revenge."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.X100!S.dialogue_text: "The memory abides. The world in pure relief I see. Nothing there is but me, my master and those who would defy his will."

A.response_text: "You speak as though you have no choice."

E.response_text: "...And those who would destroy you."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.100!SE.dialogue_text: "The world in pure relief I see. Nothing there is but me, my master and those who would defy his will."

A.response_text: "You speak as though you have no choice."

E.response_text: "I find your answer unsatisfactory."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.X200!S.dialogue_text: "Nor is this knowledge with me. For your death my task calls, time and again."

A.response_text: "You speak as though you have no choice."

C.response_text: "Then I will not attempt to enter."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.200!SE.dialogue_text: "Nor is this knowledge with me. For your death my task calls, time and again."

A.response_text: "You speak as though you have no choice."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.400!SE.dialogue_text: "Adversaries to my task do not differ. My purpose abides, and all must be stopped."

D.response_text: "Surely, there must be other areas that deserve your attention..."

E.response_text: "I command you to back down, slave!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.500!SE.dialogue_text: "Your task achieved or mine, what happens, happens. Leave."

A.response_text: "You speak as though you have no choice."

D.response_text: "Surely, there must be other areas that deserve your attention..."

E.response_text: "I command you to back down!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SENTRIES!1.600!SE.dialogue_text: "Truth may be with you. But access passed my station is not. Leave."

D.response_text: "Surely, there must be other areas that deserve your attention."

E.response_text: "I find your answer unsatisfactory."

F.response_text: "I'll only go back down there if you come with me."

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!0.X000!D.dialogue_text: Walking through the large gateway, Eidos is met with a strange sight. Before her is a descending staircase of concentric steps, fanning out into a large square hall. At first glance, this hall appears to be filled with hundreds of statues, all arranged in perfect rows. However, as Eidos draws nearer, the statues all turn to face her. Heads twist in a half circle following her path down the steps, all staring with expectation.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!0.001!DE.dialogue_text:
At the opposite end is a wide corridor, wide enough for several files of statues to pass through at a time. But perhaps most peculiar is that between Eidos and the exit there are two rather ornate sarcophagi - marbled exteriors, with several odd Glyphs engraved upon them.

		As Eidos takes in the surreality of the scene, the door suddenly closes behind her.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!0.002!DE.dialogue_text: Walking through the large gateway, Eidos is met with a strange, yet familiar sight. Before her is a descending staircase of concentric steps, fanning out into a large square hall - a hall she remembers, the Hall of Servants. The hundreds of living statues, all arranged in perfect rows, again turn to face her as she descends the stairs. Heads twist in a half circle following her path, all staring with expectation.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!0.100!DE.dialogue_text: As Eidos approaches the first sarcophagus, the Glyph of Awareness inscribed upon it resonates with her Sigil. The contraption springs to life, blossoming open and revealing its interior to her. A comfortable and inviting satin insulation fills the stony casket - though, of course, more outstanding is that there is an emerald elixir within. Looking more closely still, reflective black crystalline cuboids are suspended within the liquid like some perverse re-imagining of the night sky.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!0.200!DE.dialogue_text: Turning her back to the first sarcophagus, its lid closes.	Eyes now firmly on the second, she witnesses yet another strange symbol, obviously a Glyph of some sort, though of what, she is as ignorant as it is intricate. All she can discern is that the make of this sarcophagus is distinct from the other.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!0.201!DE.dialogue_text: Clearly, the local sarcophagus industry must be booming or, perhaps someone had amassed too great a fortune to spend it on mundane, non-sarcophagus-related accessories.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!1.000!DE.dialogue_text: Shifting her gait toward the corridor, Eidos intends to exit the chamber. She walks alone down the hallway for about a hundred paces before approaching what appears to be a dead end. Soon, the gradual emergence of the Glyph of Awareness begins to brighten the passage, resonating with the Sigil she now bears. The light fades and a portal to the outside begins to appear as the rocky wall condenses into a single point where the Glyph had shone previously.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!1.001!DE.dialogue_text: The passage fills with sunlight and the air begins to warm, even offering up a natural sweetness that was unimaginable in the stagnant dungeon whence she came. In time, Eidos steps through the portal, emerging in a wasted land...

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!10.000!D.dialogue_text: Eidos imbibes the questionable elixir. Though it is bitter, it lacks the foul-taste appearances might lead one to expect. However, as could reasonably be anticipated from drinking magic fluids of unknown origins, ill-natured effects begin to emerge...

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!10.001!D.dialogue_text: First, Eidos can feel her skin crawl, only to then feel a sudden slowing of her heart. Unsettling, true, but at least the process is painless - in truth, if anything, it more closely resembles floating in a gentle brook.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!10.002!D.dialogue_text: Eidos then drops to her knees as all her muscles release any tension held within. She kneels held up only by the natural structure of her skeleton, maintaining this pose until a sudden surge of blood courses through her veins, causing her body to pulsate rhythmically. Her hands reach for the floor, but they seem to fall through, forcing her instead to use her face for support.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!10.003!D.dialogue_text: The pulsations continue in a slow and periodic fashion, each pulse bringing back slightly more control over her body than before. Until finally she is able to push herself up off the floor.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!10.004!D.dialogue_text: The army of statues now stares at her with even greater resolve, as though ready to perish at her slightest whim. But soon their focus shifts beyond her to the corridor exiting the hall.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!10.005!D.dialogue_text: Shifting her gait toward the corridor, Eidos moves. Wordlessly, the ordered swarm of statues follows, starting when she moves and stopping when she pauses. Together, they march down the hallway for about a hundred paces before approaching what appears to be a dead end. Soon, the gradual emergence of the Glyph of Awareness begins to brighten the passage, resonating with the Sigil she now bears. The light fades and a portal to the outside begins to appear as the rocky wall condenses into a single point where the Glyph had shone previously.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!10.006!D.dialogue_text: The passage fills with sunlight and the air begins to warm, even offering up a natural sweetness that was unimaginable in the stagnant dungeon whence she came. In time, Eidos steps through the portal, emerging in a wasted land...

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!100.X000.dialogue_text:
Walking through the wide corridor, Eidos is met with a gargantuan hall and a strange sight. At first glance, this hall appears to be filled with hundreds of statues, all arranged in perfect rows. However, as Eidos draws nearer, the statues all turn to face her. Heads twist in a half circle following her path, all staring with expectation.

		Across the way, there is an ascending staircase of concentric steps, leading to a closed portal almost as tall as the chamber itself. Yet perhaps the most arresting sight is that of two rather ornate marble sarcophagi, engraved with many exotic Glyphs.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!100.001!.dialogue_text:
Walking through the wide corridor, Eidos is met with a familiar sight. The hundreds of statues, all arranged in perfect rows, turn expectantly to face her, heads twisting in a half circle as they follow her path.

		Across the way, there is the ascending staircase of concentric steps that leads to the closed portal almost as tall as the chamber itself. All this she recalls. This and the two rather ornate marble sarcophagi, engraved with many exotic Glyphs.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!100.100!.dialogue_text: As Eidos approaches the first sarcophagus, the Glyph of Awareness, inscribed upon it, resonates with Eidos and reveals its interior to her. A comfortable and inviting satin insulation fills the stony casket - though, of course, more outstanding is that there is an emerald elixir within. Looking more closely still, reflective black crystalline cuboids are suspended within the liquid like some perverse re-imagining of the night sky.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!100.200!.dialogue_text: Turning her back to the first sarcophagus, its lid closes.	Eyes now firmly on the second, she witnesses yet another strange symbol, obviously a Glyph of some sort, though of what, she is as ignorant as it is intricate. All she can discern is that the make of this sarcophagus is distinct from the other.

KABU!SANCTUARY!HALL OF SERVANTS!100.201!.dialogue_text: Clearly, the local sarcophagus industry must be booming or, perhaps someone had amassed too great a fortune to spend it on mundane, non-sarcophagus-related accessories.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.X0000!DE.dialogue_text:
Seeking the source of ethereal light, Eidos enters a tetrahedral chamber. Three sides angled in on each other make up the walls, tapering severely, high above. Reflective panels arranged on a grid cover all four surfaces like the scales of a silver serpent. The chamber itself is small, the width spanning but five paces outward from the center, though the ceiling might well be five times Eidos' height.

		Gaze now set upon the middle of the room, she sees the emerald light pervading the area emanates from a crystal. The shimmering object is suspended midair as though in some invisible, viscous fluid. Beyond it, a familiar dark glass adorns the wall, embedded chest-high at one of the intersections to the myriad reflective tiles.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.X001!DES.dialogue_text: Murky at first, but soon gaining in clarity, the image of a child soon stares back at her. The youth is of indeterminate sex and wears a simple tunic...

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.X0011!DE.dialogue_text: The youthful image of Luin materializes in the glass once more...

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.X009!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in Luin's tetrahedral chamber. Vibrantly it glows its ethereal green, just as before.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.900!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos approaches the crystal, entranced by its rhythmic pulsations. Tentatively raising a hand, she reaches out to touch it. The pulsations increase with an unbridled frenzy the closer her hand comes. Then, contact. And like a cracked dam giving way, its toxic contents - thoughts of bloodlust, innocence, death, protection - all rush through her head.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.908!DESC.dialogue_text: In a violent stroke of unchecked madness, Eidos strikes at the crystal's fragile exterior, beating it until thin fissures appear on its polished surface. The glass crackles like crystalline raindrops, heralding the advent of catastrophe.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.X9080!DE.dialogue_text: Without warning, a viridian firestorm erupts, tearing through the very fabric of space. The overwhelming speed and force with which it hits Eidos causes her Falseflesh to flash out of existence.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.909!DESC.dialogue_text:
Instinct becomes will, will then becoming thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.

		Calling to mind the Glyph of Fenrir, Eidos places hand to crystal and executes her Extraction Techne. A shock travels down her spine, spreading out like ink on fabric. Then a name - 'Luin' - resounds in Eidos' mind and the eldritch glow soon coalesces into an emerald sword - a vision of her new talent, the reward for her current pain...

A.response_text: Release the crystal before Luin's complete assimilation

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.9090!DES.dialogue_text: She releases the crystal, now inert, and watches as it slowly glides to the ground performing a final transformation, a destructive one, into a shattered mess of a thousand scattered shards.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.9091!DES.dialogue_text: Draining the remaining essence for the crystal, the pain takes hold, threatening to rob her of consciousness. Her skin radiates the intoxicating emerald haze she once saw emanating from the crystal itself. Her balance falters and she crashes into the empty crystal beside her. Under the weight of her falling body, the crystal performs a final transformation, shattering into a thousand scattered shards.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.9092!DES.dialogue_text: Falling into the sparkling rain of razor-edged fragments, Eidos knows she cannot avoid landing upon them, that her doom draws near. She knows these glassy blades will tear through her Falseflesh, leaving a bloodied honeycomb it their wake.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.9093!DES.dialogue_text: Driven down upon these spiked shards, Eidos' emerald skin denies them entrance, pulverizes them upon contact. Surprised, Eidos feels no stinging, no cuts, no damage whatsoever. She feels nothing but the diamond-like hardness of the impenetrable shield her skin has become. Eidos rises, now realizing that she is in possession of great strength. A single thought resonates across her headspace as the shock of her new talent fades away: 'Luin'.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!1.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos looks once more upon the tetrahedral chamber where Luin once dwelt. The room is now dark, empty and devoid of life. Though inanimate, it feels as though this room, this prison, is ushering her out; its wordless exhortations simultaneously thank her and beg her to use her new talents with great urgency.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!2.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos stands at the edge of an empty chamber. Toxic green sludge paints the walls, glowing with a dying light. She looks upon her destruction, admiring her handiwork, but can do no more here than this.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.000!DES.dialogue_text: Vows no sooner escaping her mouth, Eidos instinctively steps towards the green crystal, calling to mind the Glyph with which to extract her new ally from its prison. Instinct becomes will, will then becoming thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction. The crystal resonates, pulsating wildly as it exudes a brilliant miasma.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.001!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos stands transfixed as a vision of the child reaching a hand to her face fills her mind's eye. At the moment of contact, Luin's form is dissolved from within by a burning green fire. The light ablaze now races through Eidos' skin, filling every nook, every cranny of her being.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.003!DES.dialogue_text: She writhes upon the ground, an agony of soul and flesh assailing her. Another flash of searing pain grips her body and mind. She convulses wildly, as an uncontrollable lust for unadulterated violence wells up within her. Death, destruction, yet no ill will beyond them. Slaughter, annihilation, yet no evil intent behind them.

E.response_text: TYR

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.005!DES.dialogue_text: She cries out, overwhelmed by the emotions, inundated with contradictory desires. She screams until no more air remains, screams until only blood emerges from her compressing lungs. As the last echoes die out, the broken silence begins to mend. And then...

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.006!DES.dialogue_text: It is over almost as soon as it began.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.007!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos now stands in a darkened chamber, gripping the hilt of an emerald-bladed sword: the ghelblade, the Blade of Vanargand - Luin.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.008!DES.dialogue_text: She screams, overwhelmed by the emotions, inundated with contradictory desires. She screams until all the air has been expelled from her lungs. As the last echoes die out, the broken silence begins to mend. And then...

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.009!DES.dialogue_text: It is over as soon as it began.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.010!DES.dialogue_text: The light once bathing the chamber now emanates from Eidos herself. Looking down at her hands, she sees points of luminescence twinkle like emerald stars upon the fabric of her skin, evidence of the impenetrable armor her skin has become. The light begins to fade and before long, Eidos stands in a darkened chamber.

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.X000!LUI.dialogue_text: "Eidos? Kolet es nasi? Es nole nami, Luin! Kamika lasinu stike nin naka?"

A.response_text: "What are you trying to say, Luin?"

D.response_text: "What power is this that you share with the wolf?"

E.response_text: "Stop speaking nonsense."

F.response_text: "Ooo, Eee, Ooo, Ah-ah, ting-tang, walla-walla, bing-bang!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.X001!LUI.dialogue_text: "Ala marrymy?! Ysiryr Workshop ja adass Tusksikirjoi on Vanargand! Tensit valetut kaitasin stinope, jouta mevoi namen leitaka kapas sloy!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.002!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Eidos? Be that you? Luin here before you!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.003!LUIN.dialogue_text: "But, why so late are you in coming?"

A.response_text: "Nice to meet you, Luin. Sorry to keep you waiting!"

C.response_text: "Perhaps I am Eidos; I know little."

D.response_text: "Forgive me, friend! I came as fast as I could..."

E.response_text: "I don't know you, child."

F.response_text: "I smell a lust for gremlin blood about you... Join me, strange child!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.100!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Pain in waiting is no longer mine to suffer! Awakened are you now so that together we may bring others sleep!"

A.response_text: "And now that I'm awake, what do you intend to do?"

B.response_text: "Who told you to wait for me?"

E.response_text: "You will do as I say, nothing more, nothing less."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.200!LUIN.dialogue_text: "The story of your coming was told to me long ago, my kin! But so long was I in waiting, and no playmate left for me!"

A.response_text: "And now that I've arrived, what do you intend to do?"

B.response_text: "Who told you to wait for me?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.300!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Eidos you must be! Doubt yourself not! The story of your coming have I heard and now it is truth made flesh!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.3000!LUI.dialogue_text: "Though a dull waiting I had, bitterness makes the joys of life sweeter!"

B.response_text: "Who told you to wait for me?"

D.response_text: "...But you have more tasks ahead of you, do you not?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.400!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Nothing to forgive! Long was my wait, but here you at last join me!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.4000!LUI.dialogue_text: "If friends we become, longer still would I willingly have waited!"

D.response_text: "...and now your real work can begin, yes?"

E.response_text: "Friends? No. But I'll accept you as my slave..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.500!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Truth you speak, but told was I the story of your coming!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.5000!LUI.dialogue_text: "To wait here was my task, and wait I did!"

A.response_text: "And now that I have arrived, what do you intend to do?"

D.response_text: "...But you have more tasks ahead of you, do you not?"

E.response_text: "I tire of this; get to the point or be silent."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.101!LUIN.dialogue_text: "I as companion act, affording you my talents!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.1010!LUI.dialogue_text: "A good child am I, kindred Eidos! Father said I would be your friend and do as you ask."

E.response_text: "You presume much to think we will be friends."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.201!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Father did! Such trouble is he, leaving me to rust alone in this room..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.2010!LUI.dialogue_text: "He said that to obey their parents is the task of all children, but I say that to bother their children is the task of all Fathers!"

A.response_text: "But what is it that you want?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.301!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Am I glad! Father's commands were also his promise: that friends we would become and great deeds would be ours to accomplish!"

D.response_text: "Perhaps, if we don't end up like those corpses outside first..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.4010!LUI.dialogue_text: "My work was in the waiting. But to be your friend on your journey, great sport would that be to me!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.4011!LUI.dialogue_text: "A good child am I, and my great joy shall be your will!"

D.response_text: "Perhaps, if we don't end up like those corpses outside first..."

E.response_text: "Friends? No. But I'll accept you as my slave..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.5011!LUI.dialogue_text: "That by your side I would ever be bored and waiting was my fear! Now I know that we shall not merely friends be, but close kin!"

A.response_text: "And what is it you wish to achieve?"

D.response_text: "Perhaps, if we don't wind up dead like those weaklings outside."

E.response_text: "What possible value could you have to me?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.102!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Know you not, the will of all children?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.1021!LUI.dialogue_text: "And for me, my favorite games have ever been of slaughter! Always have I enjoyed a skillful parry, a deft counter, but most fun is the cutting and piercing!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.1022!LUI.dialogue_text: "Oh, hot blood raining down upon my face, my longing for it ever growing!"

A.response_text: "Why are you so fond of death?"

B.response_text: "Were you commanded to do anything else?"

E.response_text: "Perhaps you will be useful after all..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.202!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Father's goal was to help you, in his own way."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.2020!LUI.dialogue_text: "But his help, all must earn. Thus, finding me asked searching first."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.2021!LUI.dialogue_text: "An odd man, Father, but family is not chosen. Truth, is it not?"

A.response_text: "...Did he leave those bodies for me as well?"

B.response_text: "Were you commanded to do anything else?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.302!LUIN.dialogue_text: "My doubt is far from with you! Even in your absence, slain lay the Falseflesh of the Neverborn - though not yet fallen is the one Sentry upstairs; together we two may separate its Trueflesh from its false!"

B.response_text: "Were you commanded to do anything else?"

D.response_text: "It's strange to find a killer so young..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.402!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Oh, the Neverborn? Forever I seemed to wait for you, and as such..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.4020!LUI.dialogue_text: "Well, a poor excuse Father may say, but my pain in waiting was helped in ending them - though not yet slain is the one Sentry upstairs; together we two may separate its Trueflesh from its false!"

D.response_text: "It's strange to find a killer so young..."

E.response_text: "Perhaps you will be useful after all..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.502!LUIN.dialogue_text: "With my presence you will grow in strength!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.5020!LUI.dialogue_text: "Witnessed you not the outcome of my boredom in the Falseflesh of the fallen Neverborn guarding the Archives outside?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.5021!LUI.dialogue_text: "Their lifeblood paints the walls! This I say to you, without me, your path out is rough!"

A.response_text: "And what do you want in return?"

D.response_text: "It's strange to find a killer so young..."

E.response_text: "You may be useful, but I still don't trust you."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.103!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Death? This, some have called my sister. But I know not what it means."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.1030!LUI.dialogue_text: "Perhaps unlike my family are you if the joy of killing you do not see..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.1031!LUI.dialogue_text: "Yet, this reminds me, I was to see how best I might serve you..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.203!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Truth is with you! For yet another task my Father gave!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.303!LUIN.dialogue_text: "As keen as I, so you seem! Yet before leaving, another task my Father gave..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.403!LUIN.dialogue_text: "In truth? Of our nature, my brothers and sisters do our tasks. Yet our mold was cast by Father in his image."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.4030!LUI.dialogue_text: "Ah! Reminded I am of one final task given me..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.503!LUIN.dialogue_text: "As tool was I built, how could I not be useful?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!0.701!LUIN.dialogue_text: "To learn your thoughts, to know your desires, such that Father's gift suits your will!"

E.response_text: TYR

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!1.000!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Of others you seem to care, less so for yourself. You would hurt foes to help friends, and so for you, an unbreakable blade shall I be!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!1.0000!LUI.dialogue_text: "But listen! If one we become, a twisted knot may your mind receive."

B.response_text: "What do you mean by 'a twisted knot'?"

E.response_text: "How could a mere child possibly help me?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!1.200!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Of the forge of Vanargand, I the ghelblade stand before you!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!1.2000!LUI.dialogue_text: "To wield me, you must learn me, learn my thoughts and contain them..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!1.2001!LUI.dialogue_text: "But the crucible must be stronger than the metals it pours... My Trueflesh's searing burn, its absence I do not promise."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!1.500!LUIN.dialogue_text: "No child am I! The Blade of Vanargand am I! All but few fall before my cutting edge!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!1.5000!LUI.dialogue_text: "My siblings, only they are safe from me, or so belief compels. Their destruction alone was beyond my might!"

E.response_text: "I'm not interested in you joining me."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!2.000!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Eidos, seeker of truth, your unyielding shield I will be!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!2.001!LUIN.dialogue_text: "As armor, my form is impenetrable! Your Falseflesh shall bear my protection upon its very skin!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!2.002!LUIN.dialogue_text: "But take heed, should our union come to pass, change will visit your mind!"

C.response_text: "What do you mean, change will visit my mind?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!2.100!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Destruction is my main purpose, as a true weapon - and it will always please me most! Yet as armor, my form is as durable and as tough. Your Falseflesh shall bear my protection upon its very skin!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!2.300!LUIN.dialogue_text: "No ordinary armor am I! Of the forge of Vanargand am I! To wield me, you must learn me, learn my thoughts and contain them..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!2.3000!LUI.dialogue_text: "But the crucible must be stronger than the metals it pours: my soul's searing burn, its absence I do not promise."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!3.000!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Of all paths, none draws your gaze. Passive observation is your purpose..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!3.0000!LUI.dialogue_text: "Though change will visit your Trueflesh, your shield I shall be!"

C.response_text: "If that is your will, then so be it."

D.response_text: "What do you mean, change will visit my Trueflesh?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!3.200!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Destruction is my main purpose, as a true weapon - and it will always please me most! Yet as armor, my form is as durable and as tough. Your Falseflesh shall bear my protection upon its very skin!"

C.response_text: "It matters little to me one way or the other. Get on with it."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!3.400!LUIN.dialogue_text: "No ordinary armor am I! Of the forge of Vanargand am I! To wield me, you must learn me, learn my thoughts and contain them..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!3.4000!LUI.dialogue_text: "But the crucible must be stronger than the metals it pours: my soul's searing burn, its absence I do not promise."

C.response_text: "It matters little to me one way or the other. Get on with it."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!4.000!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Fear of death fills your mind, so an unyielding shield I will be!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!4.0000!LUI.dialogue_text: "As armor, my form is impenetrable! Your Falseflesh shall bear my protection upon its very skin!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!4.0001!LUI.dialogue_text: "But take heed, should our union come to pass, change will visit your mind!"

C.response_text: "What do you mean, change will visit my mind?"

E.response_text: "How could a mere child possibly help me fight?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!4.300!LUIN.dialogue_text: "No ordinary armor am I! Of the forge of Vanargand am I! To wield me, you must learn me, learn my thoughts and contain them..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!4.3000!LUI.dialogue_text: "But the crucible must be stronger than the metals it pours: my soul's searing burn, its absence I do not promise."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!4.500!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Destruction is my main purpose, as a true weapon - and it will always please me most! Yet as armor, my form is as durable and as tough. Your Falseflesh shall bear my protection upon its very skin!"

D.response_text: "Join me Luin. I do not wish to die."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!5.000!LUIN.dialogue_text: "To cleave a path for your will is your nature! As your unbreakable blade, I will help to slay those that would thwart your cause!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!5.0000!LUI.dialogue_text: "But take heed, should our union come to pass, change will visit your mind!"

A.response_text: "How can a mere child help me fight?"

D.response_text: "What do you mean, change will visit my mind?"

E.response_text: "If I will be stronger with you, I accept."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!5.100!LUIN.dialogue_text: "No child am I! Of the forge of Vanargand, Luin the ghelblade stands before you!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!5.1000!LUI.dialogue_text: "To wield me, you must learn me, learn my thoughts and contain them..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!5.1001!LUI.dialogue_text: "But the crucible must be stronger than the metals it pours. My Trueflesh's searing burn, its absence I do not promise."

E.response_text: "Join me, Luin, and help me to kill!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!5.400!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Of the forge of Vanargand, Luin the ghelblade stands before you!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!6.000!LUIN.dialogue_text: "Gremlins, unworthy enemies make! In the name of Roostor, with our union, none shall obstruct you!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!6.0000!LUI.dialogue_text: "My warning, you would not heed. So let the chaos begin!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!10.301!LUI.dialogue_text: "A shame! The Sentry upstairs obstructs your path and my help you could use."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!10.302!LUI.dialogue_text: "Yet looks can deceive, your strength and appearance may not be equally dismal..."

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!10.X303!LU.dialogue_text: "Should change visit your thoughts, return here and claim me, kindred Eidos!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.301!LUI.dialogue_text: "Returned! Change has visited your thoughts then?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!LUIN'S CHAMBER!11.302!LUI.dialogue_text: "Luck is not with me! Task compels me to not slay you and you know this, jester!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!0.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text:
Stepping across the threshold, Eidos finds herself in a room wholly unlike the one she just left. The simple geometry of the previous area looks primitive in comparison to the dizzying array of shapes that now confront her. Lines and curves intersect to form intricate, extra-dimensional patterns that lace all surfaces.

		Staring at any given surface gives the impression of standing between two mirrors and looking off into their simulated infinities. But this effect is true from all angles Eidos seems to choose, and perhaps from every possible angle.

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!0.0000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: A prismatic array of light fills the room, spilling in from narrow windows staring down from high above. These panes are stained in a variety of colors, arranged in what may as well be random patterns. What lies beyond these windows, however, is unclear.

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!0.0001!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text:
Eidos' eyes next fall upon the elliptical table dominating the middle of the room. Unfathomably dark, yet somehow polished to the point of reflection - even from under the thick layers of dust upon it. A number of smooth, lacquered chairs surround the abyssal table, all impeccably aligned with a perfect mirror's symmetry.

		Then she sees it - the blue haze's source. A spherical crystal has been placed upon a simple and unpolished jade stand, near the edge of the table. It is as dissimilar to the room as a shadow is to the light that casts it, a warped and distorted echo introduced by foreign elements into a forbidden plane.

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!0.001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Eidos reaches out and collects the crystal in her hand. It trembles in her loose grip, threatening to fall. She grips more firmly, careful not to break it. The resonance persists, gently at first but ever gaining in intensity, until finally a vision coalesces at its center. The vision links with Eidos and soon becomes her assumed reality. Through the eyes of another, Eidos remembers - not memories of her own making, yet still distinctly hers somehow.

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!0.002!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: A gathering of robed figures. Two giant beasts wrapped in a violet glow. Death. Bodies. Thetian. A frantic flight from the Enclave. To Kabu. To the Thought Wheel of the Beginning. A journey across a lifeless landscape. A dark, crimson tower painted in blood, imposing over abandoned streets. Draugnir. A void darker than night. Imprisonment in this spherical jail. And...

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!0.003!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: As suddenly as the images began, they cease. Eidos is left eyeing the crystal in her hand with great suspicion.

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!0.004!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text:
Instinct becomes will, will then becoming thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.

		Without knowing why, Eidos calls Fenrir's Glyph to mind. And without knowing how, the shining object in her hand dims as it begins to inject its contents into her Trueflesh, light waning until it vanishes completely.

		The emptied husk of crystal soon slips from her hand, crashing to the ground and cracking into perfectly equal blue slivers. But Eidos is too preoccupied with the surges of conflicting emotions now present within her mind. They seek to disrupt like unrelenting waves crashing against stubborn cliffs...

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!0.X005!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: A name etches itself into her Trueflesh. She knows the name, though she knows not why. 'Ormenos'. Riding on the Trueflesh of Ormenos, Eidos masters the Techne of Hidden Mind through the Glyph of the Occult.

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!1.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in the chamber where the Trueflesh of Ormenos once dwelt. His former crystalline prison lies perfectly shattered into equal slivers on the floor in the feebly-lit chamber. What light does shine here is pale yet colorful, seemingly oozing from stained-glass windows, but refracting midair as though obstructed by invisible prisms. However, memory tells her that this chamber holds no more secrets, no more reason to tarry idly among its polygeometric surfaces, infinitely dividing into unseen dimensions like some crazed fractal dream.

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!9.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text:
The room is now nearly pitch black, the only light seeping in from the Awakening Chamber door. The table and chairs have been reduced to rubble and ash. What were once illuminated stained-glass windows, now irreparably shattered, reveal the shadowy darkness behind them. The former splendor of the chamber has become nothing but a memory - a fragile one, soon to be forgotten.

		This room is now devoid of any further truths and memory tells her that this chamber holds no more secrets, no more reason to tarry idly among its polygeometric surfaces, infinitely dividing into unseen dimensions like some crazed fractal dream.

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!9.X000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Hurling the crystal to the floor, the glass splits with a crackling tinkle, immediately releasing a blue spark of light. In the space of a thought, the spark becomes a rapidly expanding sphere of raging energy, washing over Eidos like a burning wave, melting her Falseflesh like wax from an unsuspecting candle caught in a brushfire...

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!9.900!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Hurling the crystal to the floor, the glass splits with a crackling tinkle, immediately releasing a blue spark of light. In the space of a thought, the spark becomes a rapidly expanding sphere of raging energy, washing over Eidos like a burning wave, threatening to boil her from the inside. The shock wave blasts her up against the wall, only to let her come careening to the floor, spared instant incineration by Luin's diamond-like flesh.

KABU!SANCTUARY!MATHETIA!9.901!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text:
Opening her eyes, only now aware that she had ever even closed them, Eidos observes her surroundings. The room is nearly pitch black, the only light seeping in from the Awakening Chamber door. The table and chairs have been reduced to rubble and ash. What were once illuminated stained-glass windows, now irreparably shattered, reveal the shadowy darkness behind them. The former splendor of the chamber has become nothing but a memory - a fragile one, soon to be forgotten.

		This room is no longer host to any further truths and memory tells her that this chamber holds no more secrets, no more reason to tarry idly among its polygeometric surfaces, infinitely dividing into unseen dimensions like some crazed fractal dream.

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!0.X000!DESCRI.dialogue_text:
Eidos is on a bridge uniting cliff faces across a canyon. Far below she can make out the dried out bed of what must have once been a great river - the melancholy fate of a force that once carved canyons: to vanish into obscurity.

		Down in the canyon, she spots a gargantuan, gold-plated structure blocking passage to the other side of the canyon floor. On one side of the bridge, in the distance, is the entrance to a cave, and on the opposite end is the Antechamber.

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!0.500!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos walks out and is immediately confronted with the contorted mess of twisted metal that was the portcullis. Cautiously, ever so cautiously, Eidos crawls her way over the unsteady and knotted portcullis, nearly falling over the side of the bridge a number of times.

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!0.501!DESCRIP.dialogue_text:
After great effort, she surmounts the obstacle without incident, finding herself upon a bridge uniting cliff faces across a canyon. Far below she can make out the dried out bed of what must have once been a great river - the melancholy fate of a force that once carved canyons: to vanish into obscurity.

		Down in the canyon, she spots a gargantuan, gold-plated structure blocking passage to the other side of the canyon floor. On one side of the bridge, in the distance, is the entrance to a cave, and on the opposite end is the Antechamber.

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!1.X000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Emerging form the caverns beneath the Dawn Fortress, Eidos arrives at the Star Bridge. Glancing north and skywards, she spots the far-lengthier bridge connecting Tambul and the Dawn Fortress, and gazing down from there, the a massive bone pile beneath it.

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!1.X500!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Emerging form the caverns beneath the Dawn Fortress, Eidos arrives at the Star Bridge. Glancing north and skywards, she spots the far-lengthier bridge connecting Tambul and the Dawn Fortress, and gazing down from there, the a massive bone pile beneath it.

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!1.501!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: But far more pressing matters are at hand, as Eidos hears echoes spewing forth from the cavern's maw - the sounds of hurried footsteps. If what Logira said can be trusted, the footfalls belong to those who mean Eidos and the Dazirans no goodwill...

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!2.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Emerging form the caverns beneath the Dawn Fortress, Eidos arrives at the Star Bridge. Glancing north and skywards, she spots the far-lengthier bridge connecting Tambul and the Dawn Fortress, and gazing down from there, the a massive bone pile beneath it.

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!2.001!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: But far more pressing matters are at hand, as Eidos hears echoes spewing forth from the cavern's maw - the sounds of hurried footsteps. If what Logira said can be trusted, the footfalls belong to those who mean Eidos and the Dazirans no goodwill...

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!2.002!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: However, she is now confronted with the brutal reality of the unforgiving, twisted metal obstacle of her own making that lies near the entrance to the Antechamber. Safely surmounting it was no small feat - and that was without the added pressure of pursuers...

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!2.003!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Left with no choice, she begins to quickly scale it once more, hoping that she can make it over before the warriors arrive.

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!2.004!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Her first shaky step sets the unstable structure in motion.

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!2.005!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Now rocking to and fro, she takes her next step. A success! But one followed by the appearance of Tacribian warriors from the mouth of the cave. Spotting her, they rush forward with graceful leaps and obscene speed, like a predator locking on to its prey.

KABU!SANCTUARY!STAR BRIDGE!2.006!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Her heart rate hastens with each step her malefactors take. Panic strikes as she clambers over the broken gate. She loses her footing and with it her balance. Tumbling to her side, she rolls uncontrollably. Foot over head and head over foot she falls right over the edge of the bridge, beginning her descent into the chasm below...

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.X000!DESCRI.dialogue_text:
Eidos walks into a sea of blackness. The echoes of her footfalls betray this chamber's great size, but its features and dimensions are as of yet unknowable.

		Before long, a pale light begins shining from sconces all about, slowly waxing until the area is thrown into a stark, though colorless relief.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.0000!DESCRI.dialogue_text:
Eidos stands in a massive domed chamber, a perfect cross-section of a hemisphere, nearly one hundred paces in diameter. The ceiling is of white stone, with many large panes of black glass embedded into its polished surface.

		The chamber itself is mostly featureless but for a single silver chair standing at its center. Two other passages lead from this room: one clearly blocked by an enormous door, the other a small, round drain, not even large enough to fit a child.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.X001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: There are two exits from here: one leads back to the Winding Stair; the other is a massive arch that could fit many men walking abreast. However, it is sealed and is impassible.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.001!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: There are two exits from here: one leads back to the Winding Stair; the other is a massive arch that could fit many men walking abreast - the very same path opened by Reckoner.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.002!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Rising from the chair, Eidos notes that this room is useless but for the chair. If she finds the chair not to her liking, then why linger any longer?

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.100!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: As Eidos sits in the chair, a thin black marble column rises from the floor, responding to her presence. It is lined and laced with strands of liquid silver. The emanation of a thought seems to be coming from it, causing a sense of expectation to fill Eidos' mind - an expectation for a Glyph she knows well.

A.response_text: _Call the Glyph of Eidos to mind_

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.X101!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As Eidos brings the Glyph to mind, the plates of dark glass begin to flicker with tongues of light, while a deep, growling whir of grinding gears fills the hall...

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.X200!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As the incomprehensible voice speaks, images begin to appear in the darkened mirrors. The pane directly in front of her depicts a gargantuan chamber carved from white limestone. It is dominated by a huge black, metal sphere that is suspended over a vibrant, azure lake. The sphere slowly rotates on heavy axles mounted into the walls.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.200!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: As the voice speaks, images begin to appear in the darkened mirrors. The pane directly in front of her depicts a gargantuan chamber carved from white limestone. It is dominated by a huge black, metal sphere that is suspended over a vibrant, azure lake. The sphere slowly rotates on heavy axles mounted into the walls.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.201!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Elsewhere, a different glass displays a view of the Archives, though it must have been at an earlier time, as the two slain guards Eidos encountered previously are alive. Eidos sees a number of other figures walking about this place, reading from its many tomes and volumes. Yet another glass displays the very chamber in which Eidos sits. Here, the small round drain is being bored by individuals who seem to be wielding a concentrated flame from their bare hands.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.202!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Suddenly, all the images fade away...

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.203!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Suddenly flickering to life again, in one glass is an individual lying motionless upon a wooden table in the Workshop, while a ray of light seems to banish the skin from his very body. Another depicts a shadowy figure wielding a glowing emerald blade as it leaps into the Archive and slays the two guards before vanishing from view. A third displays hundreds of faceless creatures marching behind a figure cloaked in blue. They are led through the Throne Room and into the large archway at the other end.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.X204!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Finally, the central glass depicts the black metal orb spinning with blinding speed, now shifting tint from black, to brown, to orange, to yellow. Ever-accelerating, the violently whirling sphere finally metamorphoses to a blinding white before a flash of blue light ends the vision.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.300!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: The voice fades away. Looking over, Eidos sees that the Glyph's light in the stone column is fading with it. In sympathy, all the lights in the chamber dim.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.X301!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Having successfully completed its final task, the throne dies. Inanimate now as all its mineral brethren, it finally rests in peace...

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.302!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Having successfully completed its final task, the throne dies. Inanimate now as all its mineral brethren, it finally rests in peace...

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.303!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: But the effects of this final task are only felt as the massive stone door blocking one of the exits begins to fold in on itself. First in half lengthwise, then widthwise, ever condensing, until it appears to have completely vanished from sight, leaving unobstructed the path it once protected.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.400!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in the Throne Room, the lights dim and the throne dead silent.

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.X000!RECKON.dialogue_text: "Evirh. Otiet ei eol lapaikal. Ne atunnist piirenrakenneteine sisikomprom."

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!0.X100!RECKON.dialogue_text: "Mistake... Unreadable, the Thought Wheel Memory. Might, waning."

E.response_text: "Cease this gibbering!"

F.response_text: "You would have more friends if you spoke normally..."

E.response_text: "Tell me what's going on. Now."

F.response_text: "Hmmmm. You seem louder than most of the voices in my head!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!1.100!RECKONE.dialogue_text: "Reckoner, speaker for the Sanctuary's Thought Wheel. Warning. Might threshold for further works is reached."

B.response_text: "How did I come to be here?"

E.response_text: "Make yourself useful."

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!1.200!RECKONE.dialogue_text: "The Sanctuary Thought Wheel. Warning. Might threshold for further works is reached."

B.response_text: "How did I come to be here?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!1.300!RECKONE.dialogue_text: "Archon will unknown. Cannot reckon. Warning. Might threshold for further works is reached."

B.response_text: "How did I come to be here?"

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!1.400!RECKONE.dialogue_text: "Reckoner, speaker for the Sanctuary's Thought Wheel. Warning. Might threshold for further works is reached."

E.response_text: "Make yourself useful."

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!1.500!RECKONE.dialogue_text: "Archon will unknown. Cannot reckon. Warning. Might threshold for further works is reached."

E.response_text: "Make yourself useful."

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!1.600!RECKONE.dialogue_text: "Archon will unknown. Cannot reckon. Warning. Might threshold for further works is reached."

E.response_text: "Make yourself useful."

F.response_text: "Sweep the area of gremlins, Reckoner ol' chum!"

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!1.101!RECKONE.dialogue_text: "Archon will reckoned. Inmind Memory tomes for experiment J 3-6 called. Ghost was maintained through soulcasting. Diagnostic protocols at final stage were disabled. Ambient temperature exceeded tolerance levels. Safety protocols engaged. System failure."

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!1.201!RECKONE.dialogue_text: "Archon will reckoned. Inmind Memory tomes for experiment J 3-6 called. First, mind operation through Throne controller. Ghostheart processing of Soulcastered ghost. Re-reckoned ghost and body are cast back to Farcaster. Archon Eidos born. Further reckoning not done."

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!1.401!RECKONE.dialogue_text: "Cannot reckon. Archon will is with user, the highest tier of leave. Glyphs named as Archons are Viracocha, Vanargand and Eidos."

KABU!SANCTUARY!THRONE ROOM!1.501!RECKONE.dialogue_text: "Archon leave reckoned. Seal being withdrawn. Gate to Hall of Servants now open."

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!0.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Emerging from the tunnel, Eidos steps onto a winding stairway. Finely cut black granite, embellished with marble accents, seems the material of choice. Yet, the dominant feature here is not the stair itself; far more prominent a feature is nothingness. Even a cursory observation reveals the stairway's true nature as but a narrow strip winding around a vast column of empty space.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!0.001!DESCR.dialogue_text:
The air here is dry and stale, unperturbed long enough to stratify by density. The thickest of it clusters at the bottom, eating away all intrusions of light.

		A thin layer of dust coating the stairs suggests that Eidos' newly added footsteps are the first to disrupt the balance in quite some time. Though the steps may not have seen any recent use, they are in a state far from disrepair. Brushing away a swath of the dust with her hand, Eidos sees the floors have been carefully polished, showing no cracks, no threat of crumbling. It is as though they were only recently crafted. Rich marble veins of geometric designs carve their way through this landing, though only humble shapes adorn the individual steps leading to and from it.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!0.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Leaning over the railing and peering into the depths below, Eidos sees nothing but the spiraling stair disappearing into an inky void. So thick is the darkness, she feels she could float in it. Her suspicions feel confirmed as she observes the motes of dust floating alongside her, sparkling from their collisions with the light. They begin to dance around her, this microcosm of false stars, whirling inwards towards her. She reaches a hand out to grab them, but they quickly scurry away, propelled by the wind of her motion.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!0.003!DESCR.dialogue_text: Searching skywards, she sees that all light here leaks in through an aperture at the top of this monolithic shaft - so high above as to appear equidistant from the terminus of the bottomless void below. Golden rays weave their way down the shaft with spindly arms scraping at the darkness, as though desperately searching for some stolen treasure. Yet, the darkness nips back at the shiny intruders, jealously guarding what it hides in the depths.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!0.004!DESCR.dialogue_text: Returning her attention to the more immediate surroundings, Eidos finds that the door has vanished. The chamber beyond is now nothing but the shadow of a fading memory - the memory of an event that may or may not have ever been.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!0.005!DESCR.dialogue_text: Under the current circumstances, it seems that the only way out is through. Though, a nagging feeling gnaws at her, begging her to confirm the veracity of her memory.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!0.010!DESCR.dialogue_text: As though possessed, Eidos unwittingly reaches her hand towards the stone and, before she realizes what has happened, makes contact with it. Carefully and thoroughly, she runs her hands along the rough surface, exerting ever greater pressure upon the cold stone. Despite a most meticulous investigation of the wall, no trace of a doorway emerges. In truth, no breaks in the surface exist at all, as though this enormous silo were made of a single, impossibly large stone.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!0.021!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos has returned to the area outside where she believes she awoke. However, the wall yet hides any signs of a door being or ever having been there.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!0.100!DESCR.dialogue_text: Stepping through the portal, Eidos finds herself upon the stairway once more. Spinning on her heel, she turns to see that the chamber beyond seems to be yet again hidden behind a wall. Its existence constantly negated, Eidos determines searching for it is pointless, fighting back that nagging feeling that the portal remains somewhere beyond her Awareness.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!1.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos fights the weight of the oppressive air as she ascends the myriad steps stacked before her. Leaning against the wall for support, she climbs and she climbs until eventually, her unnumbered steps lead her to the top.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!01.X000!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos begins her descent, deeper into the maw of darkness. Time passes as surely as her feet continue to step, stumble, and engage in other gravity-aided motion. Surprisingly, the light high above never seems to dwindle as she spirals down indefinitely. Likewise, the darkness always seems to hide yet another length of stairs.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!01.001!DESC.dialogue_text:
Distracted by these thoughts, she fails to realize her body has come to a halt. To her left an anomaly appears in the otherwise perfectly uniform, albeit rough, surface of the wall. It appears she has arrived at a doorway.

		Peeking inside, she notes that the area is host to a dim light source of its own, thus revealing the silhouettes of the tables and shelves housed within.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!01.002!DESC.dialogue_text: Turning her attention once more to the stairwell, she sees that her progress has been thwarted. The stairs beyond this point have crumbled away, sabotage a likelier cause than age given the pristine condition of the stairs. And while there is another landing far beyond, one continuing the theoretical spiral trajectory into the abyss, the gap is far too wide for any reasonable person to consider leaping to it...

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!01.003!DESC.dialogue_text: Looking down from the edge, Eidos sees only oblivion - making failure to reach the opposite landing even more terrifying.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!01.004!DESC.dialogue_text: Her choices severely limited, she meditates upon the optimal course of action.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!01.010!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos descends the stairway, forgetting the passage of time to expedite her journey. In so doing, the Sanctuary Archives appear nearly instantaneously before her. Beyond this point, the abrupt termination of the stairway yet thwarts her progress; the lower landing beyond remains inaccessible - though what could ever deter the utterly irrational from trying to access it with a leap of faith?

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!01.100!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos leaves the Archives, exiting to the Winding Stair. Upwards the path toward where she believes she awakened awaits. Below, the crumbled stairway yet thwarts her progress and the lower landing beyond remains inaccessible - though what could ever deter the utterly irrational from trying to access it with a leap of faith?

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!03.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos finds herself standing upon the Winding Stair once more. Expecting to see a set of stairs spiraling skyward, she notes their absence. It appears as though she is now on the landing beyond the crumbled steps. Looking up toward the Archives' entrance, the gap seems even wider and the leap simply impossible.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!03.100!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos stands before the Workshop once more. The stairwell that would continue skyward beyond this point has crumbled away, thwarting further progress upwards. Yet the landing is visible some thirty paces away. Her irrational mind wonders if she could make the jump with a running start...

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!04.000!DESC.dialogue_text:
Her descent brings Eidos ever further from the light, and ever deeper into the inky void. In these depths the luminescent limbs of the sun weaken considerably, giving way finally to an unrelenting shadowspace.

		Wading through the darkness, taking one tentative step after the next, she begins to lose sight of the steps beneath her feet, eventually losing sight of the very feet beneath her legs. Walking on a coal-black cloud, wondering if the next step will be her last, she paws at each coming step with great focus.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!04.X001!DES.dialogue_text: After myriad heartbeats of nerve-racking descent, Eidos arrives at the final landing. While the shaft may continue from this point, the stairwell has taken her as far as it is willing to, ending cleanly at a doorway. The space within shares a kindred darkness with the shaft outside. Yet, utterly shrouded in shadow as it may be, Eidos knows it as the only territory left unexplored...

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!04.002!DESC.dialogue_text: After myriad heartbeats of nerve-racking descent, Eidos arrives at the final landing. While the shaft may continue from this point, the stairwell has taken her as far as it is willing to, ending cleanly at a doorway. The space within shares a kindred darkness with the shaft outside. Yet, utterly shrouded in shadow as it may be, Eidos recalls a memory of the Throne Room, knowing it awaits her unseen. This she knows even without understanding why she does...

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!04.100!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos emerges from the Throne Room, perhaps ready to begin the blind ascent towards the Workshop. Knowledge of its attainability shields her from fear as she puts fingers to stone, lest she step too far from the safety of the wall and gain a reason to fear anew.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!05.000!DESC.dialogue_text:
Her arms swing back and forth, preparing her body for the jump. Her legs coordinate their squat with the swing. And soon, she leaps. The mark of bravery? Insanity? Or... Awareness?

		Her hands reach out for the landing as she nears it, but it is indeed much too distant, and soon it seems to rise upwards, towards the ceiling and away from her desperate hands.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!05.001!DESC.dialogue_text: A crescendoing sense of impending doom fills her as she plummets into the depths. Blood and organs are forced to deny their inertia, forced to obey gravity's summons. It is not long before the stairs are altogether gone, consumed by the shadows.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!05.002!DESC.dialogue_text: Faster, faster, ever faster, she tumbles into the lightless abyss. As her speed increases, time seems to slow. Unfathomable distances traversed in an instant, all while seeming to never have moved at all.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!05.003!DESC.dialogue_text: Suddenly, pitch black gives way to emerald phosphorescence, as a peculiar greenish sludge now lines the walls of the shaft.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!05.004!DESC.dialogue_text: Without warning, the shaft opens into an immense cavern, appearing wider still than the winding stairwell was tall. The air racing against her face brings tears to her eyes as she speeds down towards some gargantuan object. A massive, broken sphere bearing a metallic luster, half-submerged in a vibrant, azure lake draws her nearer. Its cracked and ruined surface shows signs of some interior structure, composed of seemingly impossible geometries.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!05.X005!DES.dialogue_text: But this peek comes at a cost. Her body slams into the massive orb's pitted, sooty metal, liquefying her organs upon impact...

KABU!SANCTUARY!WINDING STAIR!05.006!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos recognizes this... thing. Some time, some place before she had seen it. But this realization dawns on her mere moments before she slams into the massive orb's pitted, sooty metal, her organs liquefying upon impact...

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.00000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos walks through a narrowing passage that funnels her into a well-lit room beyond. Sconces casting a dim, yellow light reveal what appears to be a workshop.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.00001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Grinding wheels, sketches, diagrams, tools, scraps of metal and pieces of stone seem to indicate that this place was once used for some kind of artifice. There are also inert crystals and shards of glass scattered here and there. All are perfectly ordered into discreet piles, but otherwise unremarkable.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.00002!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Walking further on, Eidos sees a number of wooden tables, littered with the varied implements of workers who once gave life to this workshop. Though at one point they must have seen constant use, they now leave only hints and shadows of their once fastidious activity.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.00003!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Elsewhere, Eidos spies a glint of crimson light emanating from a crystal disk sitting atop a nearby desk, alongside other oddly shaped tools. This seems to be the sole crystal among the lot that retains any of its energetic essence.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.00004!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: As for exits, there appears to be a staircase that descends deeper into the bowels of the building, in addition to the entrance whence she arrived.

A.response_text: Examine the items in the room

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.X0000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text:
Eidos stands again in the Workshop. Sconces - casting their dim, yellow light - give the shadows little recourse but to flee. Grinding wheels, sketches, diagrams, tools, scraps of metal and pieces of stone seem to indicate that this place was once used for some kind of craft. There are also inert crystals and shards of glass here and there, but most seem unremarkable.

		Further on, are the familiar wooden tables and among them the crimson crystal. At the opposite end of the workshop is the staircase that descends deeper into the bowels of the building.

A.response_text: Examine the items in the room

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.0000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text:
Eidos stands again in the Workshop. Sconces - casting their dim, yellow light - give the shadows little recourse but to flee. Grinding wheels, sketches, diagrams, tools, scraps of metal and pieces of stone seem to indicate that this place was once used for some kind of craft. There are also inert crystals and shards of glass here and there, but most seem unremarkable.

		Further on, are the familiar wooden tables and among them the broken remains of the crimson crystal. At the opposite end of the workshop is the staircase that descends deeper into the bowels of the building.

A.response_text: Examine the items in the room

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.X0001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Conspicuous among the items is the glowing, blood-red crystal. And, not far off, is a peculiar table that is articulated and carved in a singular fashion, which is host to a number of metal restraints. Lastly of note, on the floor lies a metallic object, a lamp or lantern of some kind, likely.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.0001!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Of note, there is a peculiar table that is articulated and carved in a unique fashion, housing a number of metal restraints. On the floor lies a metallic object, a lamp or lantern of some kind, likely.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.1000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text:
Eidos takes up the crystal in her hands. It vibrates, humming at a nearly audible frequency. Soon, she can parse out a rhythmic pulse echoed by the inner light's motion. She stares into, enraptured; it stares back, dispassionate.

		A sudden shock. A dizzying blur of alien shapes and symbols whirl through her mind's eye. A hundred familiar voices speak thousands of incomprehensible words. Before long, the nature of the sounds seem to change, and Eidos slowly begins to recognize the identity of the speakers: without exception, they all speak with the singular and unmistakable voice of Eidos herself...

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.1001!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text:
Instinct becomes will, will then becoming thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph is fully formed, completing the reaction.

		Executing the Techne of Extraction, she begins to draw the crystal's essence from it. At the acceptance of the crystal's energy into her Trueflesh, the meaning of the language becomes clear. Eidos has gained knowledge of a tome, and with it, awareness of the Script of Vanargand.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.10010!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Coming back to her senses, Eidos now sees that she has dropped the crystal and the disk has shattered on the floor into a thousand lifeless fragments.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.10011!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Returning her attention to the room she is confronted with two exits, in addition to the other items in the room.

A.response_text: Examine the items in the room

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.X1002!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The blast carves a satisfying path of destruction as it envelops Eidos in its warm embrace; and the grip of agony lulls her into unconsciousness as her ghost parts ways with her Falseflesh.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.1002!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text:
The blast carves a satisfying path of destruction as it envelops Eidos in its warm embrace. Though when her body is hurled to and fro in the maelstrom, Luin, true to its word, protects her from harm as best it can. When the firestorm dies down, Eidos gets up and brushes the dust off her body.

		Looking out upon the fruit of her labor, she sees that the items in the room have been annihilated; the farside exit likewise has been blocked by an impenetrable wall of rubble. All that's left for her now is to return whence she came.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.2000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos shifts her feet towards the table, slowly approaching it from the side. As she nears it, a visual distortion begins to take shape. The form of a man.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.20000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Drawing closer, Eidos sees the translucent figure of a sleeping man, neither young nor old. He is bound to the table in shackles, and his body is unclothed, revealing many lines and shapes that have been drawn on his skin.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.20001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The lines begin multiplying, cast across his skin like a fine, luminescent fisher's net, wrapping his entire body.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.20002!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Abruptly, the image changes. The lines disappear and the skin, square by square, along with it. Eidos now looks upon a human stripped of flesh, revealing the muscular structures underneath, yet the man continues to breathe and the table remains bloodless...

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.20003!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The luminescent net appears anew, now tracing the contours of his musculature. Though these too disappear, leaving a bleached, grinning skeleton and its nerves and blood vessels lying atop the table.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.20004!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The bones then melt away, leaving nothing but a brain, spinal cord and nerves suspended in mid-air, faintly radiating out into empty space. And suddenly...

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.20005!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: All trace of the man disappears.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.20006!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos now looks upon the empty table, leaving nothing but the impression of the vivisection she had just witnessed.

A.response_text: Examine the items in the room

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.3000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos picks up the lantern, fumbling to discover the method to ignite it. Yet a mere brushing of her fingertips across it elicits the emission of a tongue of cold flame from the top of the lamp.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.30000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Without warning, a large spout of violet fire bursts forth, yet the flame does not burn. The fire warps and twists until it forms an image hovering above the lamp. A dark sphere.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.30001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos sees the sphere spinning in empty space. At first appearances, it looks to be a planet, but as the image sharpens and comes into focus, she sees that it is spinning on a physical axle.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.30002!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The spinning stops and the orb begins to metamorphose. Its outer husk separates into two halves revealing a second ball hidden within, this one rotating in the opposite direction of the first.

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.30003!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Soon, this too divides into six equal fragments, allowing a third nested sphere to be displayed. Motionless and more ephemeral or surreal than the others, it appears to phase in and out of existence, as though it were a perpetual cycle of birth and death or a cosmic dance of creation and annihilation. And suddenly...

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!0.30005!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos looks upon a lifeless lamp once more. All that is left is the afterimage of the spheres, burned temporarily into her retinas, attempting to etch themselves into her mind.

A.response_text: Examine the items in the room

KABU!SANCTUARY!WORKSHOP!10.000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: What was once a workshop, filled with tools and materials of various natures, is now nothing more than a chaotic ruin, littered with rubble and detritus. All things here, if not charred pitch black, are then minced beyond recognition. The former exit on the opposite side has caved in and is inaccessible.
